title: Gulf Islands National Seashore: Park Home
body: The Lure of the Islands in the Gulf of Mexico  What is it that entices people to the sea?  Poet John Masefield wrote, “I must go down to the seas again, for the call of the running tide is a wild call and a clear call that may not be denied.”  Millions of visitors are drawn to the islands in the northern Gulf of Mexico for the white sandy beaches, the aquamarine waters, a boat ride, a camping spot, a tour of an old fort, or a place to fish.               Plan Your Visit   Recreation, exploration, and education...you can do it all at Gulf Islands National Seashore.            Things to Do   Whether you're at the park for a couple hours or a couple of weeks, there are activities for everyone.        Places to Go   There are 12 unique places to visit and explore at Gulf Islands National Seashore              Fort Pickens Self-guiding Tour   Download the Fort Pickens Self-guiding Tour on your mobile device.        Fort Barrancas Self-guiding Tour   Download the Fort Barrancas Self-guiding Tour to your mobile device and start your tour.        Advanced Redoubt Self-guiding Tour   Download the Advanced Redoubt Self-guiding Tour to your mobile device.
